citation.article-title: Thermoplasma acidophilum and Thermoplasma volcanium sp. nov. from solfatara fields.

p.s: Description of Thermoplasma volcanium, Segerer and Stetter, sp. nov.
Thermoplasma volcanium (vol.ca'ni.um L. neut. adj. volcanium belonging to Volcanus, the Roman god of fire, who, according to legend, lived in Vulcano, the place of isolation of the type strain.
Morphology and nutritional requirements as described for the genus.
G+C-conrent of DNA about 38 mol% (Tm and direct analysis).
Growth between 33 and 67°C (optimum: 60°C) and pH 1-4 (optimum: pH 2), depending on the strain.

Three different groups by DNA-DNA homology, not hybridizing with each other or with T. acidophilum, represented by isolates GSS1* (DSM 4299; group 1), KD3 (DSM 4300; group 2), and KO2 (DSM 4301; group 3).

Isolated from submarine and continental solfataras at Vuleano island, Italy (DNA homology group 1), continental solfataras and a tropical swamp in Java (DNA homology group 2) and continental solfararas in Iceland and the Yellowstone National Park (DNA homology group 3).
Type strain: Thermoplasma volcanium GSSP, DSM 4299, Braunschweig-Stöckheim, FRG.
